attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Esophageal cancer awareness day!
attributes.background:
Esophageal cancer is rare aggressive form of cancer.
People with esophageal cancer may experience the following symptoms or signs. Sometimes people with esophageal cancer do not show any of these symptoms. 
having a mandatory camera at the age of 50-55 is ideal
attributes.additional_details:
*Difficulty and pain with swallowing, particularly when eating meat, bread, or raw vegetables.
*Even liquid may be painful to swallow.
*Pressure or burning in the chest
*Indigestion or heartburn
*Vomiting
*Frequent choking on food
*Unexplained weight loss
*Coughing or hoarseness
*Pain behind the breastbone or in the throat

We need to make the endoscope camera mandatory for persistent cases, also we need to spread the word so having a national esophageal awareness day would be awesome!

attributes.action: Require that MPs leaving their political party resign their seat immediately.
attributes.background:
This gives the electorate of that constituency the proper opportunity to express their mandate again, rather than having to wait for the next general election. 

It also provides the resigning MP with a mandate to continue (as an independent, or in another party), should they be re-elected.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on using Single Transferable Vote in Parliamentary Elections
attributes.background:
After the last General Election we awoke to a Parliament which nearly 2/3 of the country had voted against. Now, in an age of smaller and more specialised political parties, voters are punished for backing their actual favourite candidates and parties.
We want representation, we need reformation.
attributes.additional_details:
Single Transferable Vote (STV) is a type of Proportional Representation which still allows for local candidates and representatives through use of ranges.

For more info on the imbalance between votes and seats in our current Parliament watch goo.gl/bZwsxJ

For more info on STV and why this can lead to better representation watch goo.gl/wB7ybJ

For more info on STV and it's Pros and Cons from the Electoral Reform Society visit goo.gl/urkDXf

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Make the National Insurance Number required to sign a Parliament Petition.
attributes.background:
In the highlight of the recent EU Referendum there is/was a Petition calling for a 2nd Referendum that received millions of signatures which received a lot of scrutiny.

This is because it is all too easy to sign a petition, there is no way to confirm that the person signing is a British Citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
So my proposal is to make the National Insurance Number a required piece of information to sign a petition.

This way ONLY British Citizens over the age of 16 years of age can sign a Petition and they can only sign it once, as opposed to the current format in which a person only requires a different email to sign the same petition again.

attributes.action: Negotiate and hold a new referendum on moving from EU membership into the EEA.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum has divided the country and caused chaos. To restore stability we propose that HM Government begins immediate and rapid negotiations on the terms of the UK’s possible transition to the EEA, and then holds a second referendum offering three choices: EEA, EU or neither.
attributes.additional_details:
The EEA is the European Economic Area. It includes the EU countries and Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. It allows them to be part of the EU’s single market.
Young people, who voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU, need hope. 16 and 17-year-olds should have the right to vote in the second referendum.
Ireland created strong and democratic precedent for a second EU referendum. Their 2008 referendum rejected the Lisbon Treaty. The government then renegotiated, and a second referendum passed it.

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: primary schools to teach kids private parts are private, and don't keep secrets
attributes.background: help prevent child abuse, if children no from a young age that private parts are private an don't keep secret games this can help prevent child abuse no matter how much you trust the person who looks after your child you can never totally be sure, a lot of child abuse is done by a family member.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me an sign this petition an share it, I couldn't help some one who is very close to me but this might be able to help someone else !!

attributes.action: Establish an independent department to ensure truthful politics
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaigning world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to them, we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new independent department should consist of teams from Ofcom,Advertising Agency,CPS,ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Get teachers in ALL schools more training on teaching kids with disabilities
attributes.background: My brother has autism spectrum disorder and went to many mainstream schools. He was bullied and taken advantage of by the kids and teachers never understood his meltdowns, having to come and get me. I think that ALL teachers, need to be trained and qualified on how to teach ALL types of children.
attributes.additional_details: Teaching kids, teenagers and adults with disabilities isn't rocket science. It just takes a bit of training and a lot of patience. Not only would it be great for the teachers to be able to teach both neurotypical and disabled children, but it would also help the children, they would feel more socially accepted and not put down by a disability they can't help thenselves having (or, as I see it, a gift too special for people to handle). Please help raise awareness and maybe get training in place.

attributes.action: Protect access to state funded benefits and services for humanitarian workers.
attributes.background: Humanitarian workers who serve oversea with registered charities are discriminated against and do not have the same access to publicly funded benefits and services that UK dwelling people do. Their service in the national interest means that they no longer meet presence based qualification criteria.
attributes.additional_details: In recognition of their contribution to the national interest certain categories of workers, like military personnel and public servants, have their access to benefits and service protected when living overseas in the line of duty. Thus they are treated by legislation as being physically present in the UK, even when overseas. This protection of rights to access state funded assistance or services, from discretionary or mandatory disqualification, should be extended to humanitarian workers.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Counselling and Psychotherapy, to properly protect the public.
attributes.background:
Anyone can call themselves "counsellor" or "psychotherapist", even with no qualifications at all.

Such people are a potentially fatal danger to clients, yet are currently free to practise.

There are societies to belong to, accreditations to gain and registers to join, but all are optional.
attributes.additional_details:
Successive governments have promised to regulate counselling for over a decade, but none have done so.

The "Accredited Register" scheme was created in 2013, and is like "CORGI" for counsellors. It sets minimum standards of training, insurance etc. However, you don't have to join a register and clients do not necessarily even know of its existence.

Regulation would protect the titles "counsellor" and "psychotherapist" and prevent those who do not meet minimum safety standards from practising.

attributes.action: Give Police a power to seize vehicles of those caught driving & using mobiles
attributes.background: Following the jailing today of Tomasz Kroker for 10 years for causing the deaths of Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith, it's time this country toughened the law on using a mobile phone behind the wheel.
attributes.additional_details: Most people don't even think about it.  They answer a call, they write or read a text whilst driving, they change music tracks like Tomasz Kroker as he drove a heavy goods vehicle.  Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith were on their way back from a holiday when they were killed instantly.  You have probably seen the moving video of their relatives describing the aftermath.  Sign this petition in their memory & for radical change.

attributes.action: Acknowledge 'secondary modern' schools are created by grammar schools.
attributes.background: The government want to create new grammar schools but say 'secondary modern' schools will not exist. Schools surrounding grammar schools can not contain a full range of pupils of all abilities, this means they are are not truly 'comprehensive' schools. I want this difference officially acknowledged.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 163 grammar schools selecting high ability pupils and 400/500 schools with low/medium ability pupil intakes as a result. These 'secondary modern' schools can not perform in the same way as a comprehensive school when the balance of pupils is so different.

Please sign this petition to ask the Department for Education to identify these schools and classify them as 'secondary moderns' or similar new name. This will help us research these schools properly before there are more.

attributes.action: Do not allow the sale of our utilities to foreign companies
attributes.background: A Chinese consortium are trying to purchase a majority stake in National Grid's £11billion gas distribution network. The Prime Minister promised tighter regulations on foreign investments in the UK, it seems to be an empty promise. Our utilities need to stay under British control. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Bring March into the light
attributes.background: Simple as this - put the clocks forward at the end of Feb instead of March.  It'll still be bright for the morning commute & school run and we'll gain an hour on the evenings, shortening those winter blues. It'll be good for the economy too. Win Win!

attributes.action: Make the A420 between Oxford and Swindon a dual carriageway.
attributes.background: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor
attributes.additional_details: The A420 between Oxford and Swindon is too busy  It is the main A road shortcut to the south west.  The alternative route is 19 miles longer down the A34 and the M4.  It badly needs dualling.  The proposed trunk road between Cambridge and Oxford should extended to Swindon via the A420 corridor

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Andrea Leadsom should be forced to apologise for her comment on male carers.
attributes.background: The Minister for the Environment should be forced to come before the house and apologise to both the house and men across the UK for her statement that hiring men to look after your children was more of a risk as the persons hired "could be paedophiles".
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/andrea-leadsom_uk_5788a201e4b08078d6e8699c?9zveu3di has the quote:

“As an employer we’re not, let’s face it, most of us don’t employ men as nannies, most of us don’t,” she told the paper. “Now you can call that sexist, I call that cautious and very sensible when you look at the stats. Your odds are stacked against you if you employ a man. We know paedophiles are attracted to working with children. I’m sorry but they’re the facts.”

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Ban lorries from overtaking on dual carriageways, and motorways between 7am-7pm
attributes.background:
We've all been stuck on a dual carriageway doing fifty behind a lorry driver who feel they need to overtake another lorry doing two or three miles per hour less than them.

The same happens on motorways and causes the same issues when a somebody tries to overtake both of those lorries at sixty.
attributes.additional_details:
It clogs up road which are designed to be freely moving and can cause miles of tailbacks.

Even more frustrating is when as soon as they have finished their overtake they take the exit off the road.

My proposal is to ban lorries from overtaking on a dual carriageway at any time, and a ban on lorries overtaking between 7am and 7pm on motorways.

If you agree please sign.

attributes.action: Ensure political advertising carries an ASA disclaimer
attributes.background: Unlike any other advertising, political advertising is exempt from the remit of the Advertising Standards Authority. The public expects all adverts to be legal, decent and truthful, including political adverts.  All political advertising should carry a disclaimer about exemption from ASA standards.

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Independence referendum for N. Ireland and Scotland
attributes.background: There is a great divide between England, N. Ireland and Scotland because Scotland and N. Ireland both had majority remain but were dragged to leave the EU, we need more democracy, if they want to stay, let them, don't force them
attributes.additional_details: They all voted remain, so they should get what they want rather than being forced by another constitution that a lot of Scottish and N. Irish people want to leave. As we are the British, we pride our selves on being democratic so we must respect their decision even though we might not agree with it like when Germany, France and USA respected our decision when we voted Brexit.

attributes.action: Parliament to pass a Bill affirming the UK will remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
The UK is is a Parliamentary democracy. Only Parliament has the power and the responsibility to decide this issue. Parliament is not bound by the referendum.

The majority of the UK electorate did not vote to leave.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action: Ask retailers to not automatically issue receipts but instead give us an option.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that 12 BILLION receipts are issued in the UK alone each year and most end up in the bin.
By opting to not have your receipt you could help save Rainforests from deforestation, reduce waste, reduce oil and water consumption and help conserve this planet. Retailers also reduce costs.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no requirement under the sale and supply of goods act 1994 act to supply a receipt to prove that a contract exists between buyer and seller, nor is there any requirement to provide physical evidence of any kind, except for the faulty goods/purchase. 

Retailers would also save thousands of pounds in reduced costs.

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to produce and use products made of non-recyclable plastic
attributes.background: We need to stop thinking that plastic waste is being dealt with to the degree at which it is advertised. We do not need non-recyclable plastic, and this is evident by the amount we only use once - then throw away every day.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of plastics marked 'recyclable' are not recycled in the UK (mostly mixed plastics) and are instead sent abroad to be disposed of. As a result of this, we need to open far more facilities capable of processing and recycling mixed plastics. Our use of non-recyclable plastic is unsustainable, irresponsible and unnecessary.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Enact schedule 6 of the 2009 Welfare Reform Act on Joint Birth Registration.
attributes.background: S.111 of the Adoption & Children Act 2002 demonstrated a turning point in Family Law, permitting unmarried fathers to obtain parental responsibility if their name is registered on their child's birth certificate. However, responsibility for registering the birth still lies mainly with the mother.
attributes.additional_details: In England & Wales every year around 7% of births are solely registered by mothers meaning upto 45,000 children do not have their father named on their birth certificate. Research shows that fathers' impact on their children is central to the child's healthy development. With rapidly changing social infrastructures there is a growing trend away from marriage and towards cohabitation. JBR will reinforce the important role fathers play in their children's lives, both practically and symbolically.

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Extreme vetting of immigrants and visitors to the UK
attributes.background: I would like to call for "extreme" ideological vetting of immigrants seeking admission to the UK. People coming to this country must decry their former way of life, and agree to live under a FREE Society who allow FREEDOM OF SPEECH!
attributes.additional_details:
Hate Speech should equally mean HATE speech against Jews and Christians too ... not just islam. It needs to be stated categorically that islam is NOT a race, it is made of many races, just as Christianity is.
People entering should undergo a test, and have to prove they will no longer follow the laws they left. Implementing the policy overhaul would require a temporary halt in immigration from "the most dangerous and volatile regions of the world that have a history of exporting terrorism

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: Restrict Rail Franchise Owners paying excessive dividends when performance fails
attributes.background:
Some Train Operating Companies have fallen far short of their Public Performance Measures (PPM).

Simultaneously Franchise Owners - such as the Go Ahead Group - continue to pay material dividends that offer investors an attractive yield (e.g. 4-5%) which is 10 to 20 times the typical savings rate.
attributes.additional_details:
The PPM of the GoVia Thameslink Group (Southern, GEX and TL) is around 70% in 2016 so far - against the target for of around 86%. One in 3 trains is late.

The service that funds their dividends has failed to meet acceptable standards, and annual fare increases continue to be applied which contribute to that dividend.

This petition seeks to apply legislation that forces Franchise Owners to limit dividend distribution when PPM and other measures fall materially, and serially, short of target.

attributes.action: Standardise child age groups where there is an entrance fee. 18+ is adult
attributes.background: I believe pricing of  attractions should be fair. And having to pay adult prices to gain entry to attractions, shows, holidays. Flight's etc for anyone under 18 is wrong. When you have a young family it is becoming increasingly expensive to do anything when you have to pay full price adult children
attributes.additional_details: Alton Towers Adult prices start at 12+ since when have 12 year old been adults. This is one example of countless organisations and companies that routinely choose thier own age limits for pricing. We need a country if not worldwide pricing structure so parents don't get ripped off

attributes.action: To make the use of the word "midget" a hate crime.
attributes.background: The use of the word "midget" is used as a hate crime directed at people of short stature. People with restricted growth, frequently experience others insulting them either directly or indirectly with the inappropriate word "midget". This must stop! It is cruel and vile and has no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Restricted growth is commonly described as having a final adult height of 4’10” or less due to a medical condition.
Most people who have restricted growth have it due to a genetic condition. There are estimated to be several hundred conditions that can cause restricted growth, these can cause proportionate or disproportionate, such as Achondroplasia, restricted growth.

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from UK driving licenses and V5 documents as soon as possible
attributes.background: The UK is now in the process of leaving the EU. It is therefore unnecessary and wrong to have important UK legal documents displaying the EU flag. Along with having a blue UK passport; UK driving licenses and V5 documents should display the Union Jack instead of the EU flag.

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Stop the monitoring of benefits spending.
attributes.background: Benefit payments are a lifeline. These payments are funded by the public as an insurance against misfortune. The monitoring of these subsistence payments is a gross misuse of public money and an abuse of the public trust. People are entitled to spend their benefits as they choose.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.thecanary.co/2016/07/13/snooping-on-benefit-recipients-spending-and-is-totally-legal-with-this-phone-app/

attributes.action: British Isles devolution to allow regions to choose RemaIN in the EU or Leave.
attributes.background: Mainland Denmark is in the EU, whilst devolved Greenland and Faroe Islands are in Denmark but not in the EU. Great Britain and Northern Ireland are in the UK and therefore the EU, while the Isles of Jersey, Guernsey and Man are in the British Isles but not in the UK or the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Areas of England and Wales that wish to leave the EU, could devolve out of the UK (and therefore the EU), whilst remaining in the Kingdom of the British Isles. We would all still be British citizens under the Queen and sovereign parliament in Westminster. 
London, NI and Scotland could remain in the EU.
This would be cheaper, simpler, more flexible and quicker than Brexit.
We request that the UK government hold a referendum on all realistic options for the relationship between the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Freeze funding for students fallen ill until recovered enough to return.
attributes.background: It is completely unfair on those students who fall ill to have to pay for their education should they want to return to study in recovery. This applies to many illnesses but especially mental illness. This petition asks for the funding to be frozen (for up to two years) until they're able to return.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.
